entries.title: The United States commits an additonal $2.5 billion in food assistance to Africa
entries.description: On Thursday, Joe Biden announced he was planning a visit – the first by a US president since 2015 – to sub-Saharan Africa.

entries.title: Danish Prime Minister Frederiksen presents new three-party government
entries.description: Denmark's Social Democrats will govern with the Liberal Party and the Moderates.

entries.title: French prosecutors raid General Electric site in tax fraud probe
entries.description: GE is is suspected of having avoided millions of euros in taxes.

entries.title: US-Africa summit: Joe Biden's charm offensive
entries.description: The United States wants to devote $55 billion to the continent over three years, as China invests in major infrastructure projects.

entries.title: German economy withstands crisis better than expected, boosted by consumption
entries.description: The Ifo Institute now expects a mild recession in 2023. A strong rebound in private consumption lifted the economy this year, despite strong inflation.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Fernando Santos quits as Portugal coach
entries.description: Portugal were elimated in the quarter-finals by Morocco.

entries.title: Slovak government collapses after losing no-confidence vote
entries.description: The president will have to appoint a new prime minister to form a government, but early elections could also be called.

entries.title: 'Qatargate': What we know about the suspected corruption at the European Parliament
entries.description: Four people are detained in Brussels as part of an investigation into suspected corruption benefitting Qatar.

entries.title: EU leaders grant Bosnia candidate status for membership
entries.description: Earlier this year, Moldova and Ukraine were also granted candidate status. But the process to full membership can take many years.

entries.title: Pensions: Macron and PM Borne's disagreements slow reform
entries.description: Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne convinced President Emmanuel Macron to delay the presentation of the pension reform. Now she is hoping to soften his position on the retirement age.

entries.title: Twitter suspends account tracking Elon Musk's plane
entries.description: Mr. Musk's social media recently updated its policy to prohibit tweets from giving away someone's current location.

entries.title: Left-wing leader Mélenchon accused of pushing out influential party members
entries.description: Several senior figures from the La France Insoumise party were excluded from the new leadership team.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Morocco's big dream dies but the legend lives on
entries.description: The Atlas Lions' defeat to France in Wednesday's World Cup semi-final does not erase Morocco's remarkable football journey in Qatar.

entries.title: ECB opts for 0.5-point rate hike but inflation still 'far too high'
entries.description: The latest interest rate increase is smaller than previous hikes, mirroring the steps taken this week by the US Federal Reserve and Bank of England.

entries.title: France beats Morocco to qualify for its fourth World Cup final
entries.description: The French team put an end to Morocco's dreams on Wednesday (2-0) to play against Lionel Messi's Argentina on Sunday.

entries.title: Macron urges Europe to act more quickly to counter US subsidies
entries.description: EU leaders are meeting in Brussels on Thursday to find a way to counter Joe Biden's Inflation Reduction Act.

entries.title: 'Qatargate': Operation clean up for the socialists in the European Parliament
entries.description: Most of the defendants in the 'Qatargate' scandal are linked to the Socialists & Democrats group.

entries.title: UK nurses hold biggest strike of its kind in history
entries.description: Patient care in England, Wales and Northern Ireland is set to face severe disruption.

entries.title: Interior Minister's visit to Nice forces closure of bookstore displaying feminist slogans
entries.description: The slogans, targetted at the French Interior Minister, were concealed by local authorities. The bookshop has taken the case to court for infringement of freedom of expression and trade.

entries.title: 'Pandora Papers': Dominique Strauss-Kahn under investigation from French authorities
entries.description: Investigators are looking into the Moroccan tax residency status of the former IMF head who has turned to consulting for governments and large private sector companies.

entries.title: The French army is facing logistical challenges in Romania
entries.description: The Romanian military camp housing French troops deployed to reinforce NATO's eastern flank lacks the infrastructure to accommodate so many soldiers and equipment.

entries.title: COP15 on biodiversity: A decisive last stretch as environment ministers prepare to meet
entries.description: The environment ministers participating in high-level and high-stakes talks starting on Thursday will have to find compromises on major sticking points.

entries.title: Celebrations on the Champs-Elysees after France makes World Cup Final
entries.description: There was little sign of tension as supporters waved tricolour flags and let off flares alongside Moroccan supporters.
